Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
08/15/24. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified
by another agency the borrowing agency shall
have a record containing all the following:
• (f) Documentation that the foster parent has
received orientation to the policies of the
borrowing agency.
One of three borrowed bed files documented that the foster parent received
o rientation to the policies of the borrowing agency after placement of the child.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified
by another agency the borrowing agency shall
have a record containing all the following:
• (g) A copy of the foster parent /agency
agreement signed by the foster parent and
the borrowing agency.
One of three borrowed bed files documented that the foster parent received and
signed the parent/agency agreement after placement of the child.
2

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Rule 400.12415 (a) Incident reports. Discussed the requirement that
incidents reports are to be submitted to the consultant. Only those
incidents named under the rule are to be submitted.
• DCWL review of CAPS. The agency was informed that starting January
1, 2024, interim and renewal audit CAP's will be reviewed with the agency
at three months and six months. The assigned Consultant for the agency
will work with the agency in conducting CAP reviews. This process for
special investigation CAP reviews was implemented previously.
• Rule 400.12209 (2) (a) Orientation and Training. The agency was
informed that all the training requirements listed under (2) (a) are required
yearly for foster care workers carrying a caseload as well as for
supervisors who may be carrying a caseload.
• R 400.12204 (1) (e) Financial stability. The agency was advised that a
certified public accountant audit of the agency needs to be conducted
yearly as required by the rule. An audit for the year 2024 should be
completed in 2025 and be ready for the 2025 DCWL audit inspection.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans (CAP)
during this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The assessment notes there
were no violations established during the renewal audit in 2023 and therefore,
there was no CAP to review. The assessment detailed how monthly management
reports are reviewed by the Chief Administrator. The assessment documented
3

100% compliance on service plans, medical and dental appointments as well as
other compliance areas.
Financial Overview
The agency budget was reviewed and there were no noted concerns.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling supported by their supervisor and agency
administration. Staff reported feeling like they are part of a supportive and high
functioning team.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern well maintained building in Brighton. There is
sufficient office space. CHRI documents were observed to be secured
appropriately.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The agency does not have any licensed foster homes.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
